description: The Congo African Grey is the larger of the two common subspecies, with silvery-grey feathers, a white mask around the eyes, and a bright red tail. They have a solid black beak.
temperament: Extremely intelligent, highly sensitive, and can form very strong bonds with their owners. They can be prone to anxiety and stress if not properly stimulated.
loudness: Moderate to Loud. Can develop loud screams, especially if seeking attention.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Renowned for their exceptional ability to mimic human speech and sounds with incredible clarity.
dietaryNeeds: A balanced diet of high-quality pellets, fresh vegetables (especially those high in Vitamin A like sweet potatoes and kale), fruits, and a limited amount of nuts.
healthPointers: Can live for 50-80 years. Susceptible to feather-picking, psittacosis, and hypocalcemia (low calcium levels). Regular mental stimulation is crucial for their well-being.
housing: Requires a large space. A cage of at least 40"W x 30"D x 60"H is suitable. Their potential for loud calls makes them a challenge for apartment living.
